comments.body: There's most likely a technical reason for this, but if not, PLEASE DO THIS.

Found out how to do this in Java

1. Click on the world
2. Click "edit world"
3. Click "export world generation settings"

Hopes this helps! =)

I think that they should still keep it, since Minecraft‚Äôs fanbase has a lot of children in it, but make it so it will be easily spotted. When it shows that ‚ÄúOnline Play‚Äù disclaimer, it should also show the toggleable option for Verified Skins only that you can turn on and off from there.

Let me tell you, the "Nether" ("what is below" in Dutch) in Minecraft is not related at all with the hell of any religion, it's actually based on the real life inner layers of Planet Earth, which have immense quantities of molten rock and extreme high temperatures, with the addition of creatures like ghosts and a Pig people society, it's not the place "bad people go after death" for the catholics.

Even if you uninstall 1.16 the nether will still exist
Plus The Nether is a core part of minecraft's progression, It is impossible to get rid of the nether without getting ridding of new Minecraft updates permanently by the ways how is pigs and yellow fire creatures (blazes) anyway like Hell.
simply dont let kids make this bruh

You've probably abandoned this post, but I think you could still use this:

Hades from Greek mythology aligns more with the Nether. Hell in the Biblical context isn't a place where you can walk around and be chill, it's a place where chill doesn't exist. The Nether allows you some chill time, so it's absolutely nothing like Hell in that respect. Plus, I like the Nether because it makes me think of how Christ went to Hell and back to save us.

That's a short little explanation of why the Nether doesn't offend me. But, about that last line...

If you really want to protect your kids, focus on that last line. Maybe teach them about that. Use this as an opportunity, maybe. Otherwise, good luck deleting the update. üëçüèº

**Here's also a nice little idea that gives your kids a way to avoid the Nether entirely (I also commented there)

Sky Dimension ‚Äì Minecraft Feedback
you tend to have to manage your inventory with a chest, they are trying to standardize it with the pc players as i think thats the main audience
Yeah pc has the same problem.you dont recieve items back in your inv and th crafting is so different

This is particularly usefull when swiming and when using system shortcuts that use the sprint/sneak key (Ctrl-Alt-Righ by example) as this toggle the state a I always get to double hit the key to ensure I'm really runnig.
Best to also add the option to turn them off if needed, but this is something that always bothers me. I believe more players would go with toggle instead of hold if this was possible.

Maybe this should be a client-side option you can enable rather than a default function - it's useful for the scenario you mentioned, but rotating item frames can also be used to control redstone. Having to shift to do that would also be annoying.

A better idea may be to add a way for a player to lock the orientation of an item frame in survival mode, and allowing the player to open a chest "through" a locked item frame.

In addition, if there were a way for the narrator to start speaking quicker that would be helpful. If I move the mouse too fast I don't know that I've got over a button (or possibly enabling tabbing through menus instead)?

As a blind pc user I tried playing around with minecraft but noticed real quickly that the key functions did not work with my screen reader running. I use jaws and there are more out there like narrator for the pc, nvda (open source), or voice over for the mac. My main idea is could you label everything  in a hidden  sub menu or something so we can easily notify what the item is along with working on keyboard navigation. I  normally use the arrow keys  as the normal character movement, space bar to jump up, tab  for eith a toggle or like a dash button. I have been trying to figure out how to do it myself but not really good at coding, just would like to see minecraft to be more accessible for completely blind people and other people who need accessible  help. So in otherwords can you make the keyboard with jaws do everything a mouse can do without it being clunky?
I think it will be a good thing and create more of an incentive building one of these.

It can already cook food if you right-click, and the whole point is that it does not use fuel and cooks 4 food in 30 seconds so that is incentive enough for me. It isn‚Äôt just decor in the first place so what is the point of this?
i think the point is that you wouldn't just need to wait 30 seconds for them to pop out on the ground , Instead they are placed where they are waiting for you to pick them
I think it would be cool to turn off mob spawning completely for some mobs too.
I mean the language Zulu
The type of items will be better
It depends on wich Minecraft edition you play, but in Java you can look the biome up on the F3 Screen.

I would model this after the Survival Version with the Crafting Book. The Player's Inventory would be on the right while the Creative Inventory would be on the left, with reduced size but able to scroll down. It would also have more tabs. The Chest would then become a button that triggers whether or not the Player's/Creative Inventory is shown.
I never use the recipe book and I have to close it each time I open the inventory. Please implement this.

critical points:

  • Giving more options can be overwhelming, therefore I think there should be a few pre-made combinations of settings that you can load, similar to the current difficulty settings

  • When there are a lot of options it should be easy to reset to the default settings

  • If you somehow lose your settings you were playing with, it could be frustrating to get everything back to the way you like it. Therefore I think settings should be able to be saved under a name so that you can reload them easily.

  • Getting settings just right can take a lot of time. If settings can be saved, they could also be shared with other players

 

motivation:

I have quite a lot of suggestions for changes to the gameplay, but I can also see that my playstyle may be very different from the playstyle of others. I understand that balancing the game to be fun for all the different types of players is quite challenging, and probably even impossible. That is why I think that there should be more options to customize certain aspects of the gameplay. This way both old and new players(and also people who prefer role-playing, PVP, adventuring, building, etc.) can make the game fun and challenging, based on their own skills and preferences.

How could it work:

I imagine a tab in the menu called something like 'difficulty settings' clicking on the button would bring you to a new menu with different categories like, general, mob spawning, combat, weather, farming, loot, screen/render, etc. Each of these categories are buttons as well, and bring you to some more advanced settings. I imagine these settings to be sliders, just like the FOV and brightness settings for example, with the middle position being the default setting, sliding it to the right would make the setting more extreme,(faster, more, harder, etc.)while sliding it to the left would make it less extreme(slower, less, easier).

I think there should be an option to quickly set all settings back to default, an option to save a combination of settings with a name, and also an option to load saved settings, and maybe also some pre-made setting combinations. If these settings could be saved per individual world, that would be great. This way, you could set yourself different challenges in different gameplay worlds, and servers as well.

Examples of settings I was thinking about

Player related settings:

- increase or decrease player movement speed, less movement speed makes traveling harder, and encourages the use of horses, minecarts, etc, and increases immersion with your world(could be fun for people who like to explore, in a more challenging way). higher movement speed would make traveling easier, which would be more fun for people who travel more as a means to an end.

- increase or decrease how fast the player gets hungry

- increase or decrease the amount of fall damage.

Monster related settings:

- increase or decrease monster spawn quantity(can make nighttime harder or easier)

- increase or decrease monster difficulty(can make nighttime harder or easier. example: in combination with the previous setting you could make fewer monsters spawn, but make each of them harder to defeat, and drop more loot, in combination with the loot settings)

- spawn frequency for individual mobs.

- (checkbox): monsters attack tamed animals

- (checkbox): monsters(zombies) attack villagers (for people who do like to fight monsters, but don‚Äôt want to babysit the villagers)

combat-related settings:

- increase or decrease attack speed

- increase or decrease attack cooldown

- increase or decrease player damage

- increase or decrease effectiveness critical hits

- (checkbox) auto/manually equip armor

- (checkbox) hold to attack

loot related settings:

- increase or decrease loot quantity from chests

- increase or decrease loot quantity from mobs

- increase or decrease loot quantity from crops.

- increase or decrease the chance of rare loot(for example flint, apples, but also wither skulls).

farming-related settings:

- increase or decrease time crops need to grow

- increase or decrease the time saplings/trees need to grow

- increase or decrease the time animals need to grow

(checkbox) automatically replant seeds when you harvest

(checkbox)dropped saplings plant automatically

weather-related settings:

- rain frequency

- thunderstorm frequency

(the next settings could be world settings(fixed for all players in the world), but also visual settings(settings individual players can tweak in a multiplayer world))

- turn on/off clouds

- increase or decrease fog distance

 

examples of different playstyles that could be created using these settings:

  • less, but stronger monsters spawn, with more loot. for more adventurous and challenging playstyle.

  • more, but weaker monsters spawn, could be used for some sort of tower defense kind of playstyle

  • farming takes longer, so you will need to plan things out more, or a nomadic lifestyle becomes more attractive

  • easy monsters: monsters are rarer, and/or weaker, drop more loot, and don‚Äôt attack villagers, this could be a good alternative for the peaceful mode, which limits your options in the game.

 

I hope this feedback was clear enough, If not, feel free to ask.

I can‚Äôt believe this hasn‚Äôt gotten any votes. I came to suggest something similar but this is way more detailed. I want more customized difficulties. I‚Äôd like to have the ability to have mobs spawn but they‚Äôd all be neutral until attacked but still hit as hard as hard difficulty. Also an option to not attack villagers as villager AI is just too terrible to avoid monsters.

I want a toggle that causes hunger to drop even while not moving so there‚Äôs actual reason to farm.

The preset difficulties are just far too limiting. I would keep preset difficulties to not overwhelm people but have a custom menu for difficulties with the ability to save custom presets.

I've heard technical players argue that the hard difficulty is actually easier in some cases. For instance, villagers have a 100% chance of converting into zombies, but that allows players to decrease their price when curing them. Someone playing in easy or normal might lose a villager that they actually really wanted.
I'm having the same issue. The new update has caused this, I have tried everything to fix it and it's not working.
Absolutely yes. The only workaround that I could find over two years later is to disable my second monitor during gameplay.

This has become very frustrating when playing and accidentally click on another screen. I shouldn't need to be looking for third party applications to fix something that every other game can get right by default...
At least on Java, this should be doable with a resource pack by editing the "sounds.json" file to play no sounds for cats or dogs.

go to vanilla tweaks . net and find their peace and quiet resource pack mods. It reduces sounds by 75% which is enough. You can then edit the .ogg files yourself if you want them to be even quieter. My dog and cat were freaking out too lol.
I think this should be the default for all advancements, like the visit every biome one or the tame all cats (if it is, my apologies - I'm not well versed in the advancements)
Yeah this should be for all advancements that require multiple things
